roleset.name: be in a position
roleset.note: SIT-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of Vncls put_spatial-9.2-1, spatial_configuration-47.6, assuming_position-50. (from sit.01-v)

example.name: sit-v: explicit location
example.text: ``You've got two champions sitting right before you,'' said Mr. Baum.

example.name: sit-v: manner instead of position
example.text: Traders said most of their major institutional investors, on the other hand, sat tight.
example.arg: most of their major institutional investors

example.name: sitting-n: Arg1,2
example.text: I'm pretty sure the dog is gaming us with his constant sitting by the door to go out.

roleset.name: take an examination
roleset.note: NAME-V NOTES: Added by Julia for BOLT

example.name: sit-v
example.text: I failed Arabic hahaha , I 'm going to sit for the make - up exam this week and I 've applied to GUC

example.name: sit-v
example.text: In 1912, Siobhán sat an exam for a vacancy in the Mallow Post Office and succeeded in getting the position.
example.arg: an exam for a vacancy in the Mallow Post Office

roleset.name: sit_on: keep secret, have access to info but not do anything about it

example.name: sit-v
example.text: He is probably sitting on a similar story about Uncle Joe .
example.arg: on a similar story about Uncle Joe

roleset.name: assume a seated position
roleset.note: SIT_DOWN-V NOTES: predicate edited by Arrick. Member of VNcls assuming_position-50. (from sit.02-v)

role.descr: second sitter if separate from arg 1

example.name: sit_down-v: and shut up
example.text: Doug Hammond, the federal mediator in Seattle, where Boeing is based, said [the parties]-1 will continue *trace*-1 to sit down daily until a new settlement proposal emerges or the talks break off again.
example.arg: until a new settlement proposal emerges or the talks break off again

example.name: sit_down-v: with arg 2
example.text: and we 'll sit down with you one on one.

roleset.name: assume an upright seated position
roleset.note: SIT_UP-V NOTES: No official Vncls, but see assuming_position-50. (from sit.03-v)

example.name: sit_up-v: wakey wakey
example.text: ...the influence of the appeals court in New York ``will make insurers sit up and listen.''

roleset.name: decline to participate
roleset.note: SIT_OUT-V NOTES: sit_out added by Miriam. No Vncls. (from sit.04-v)

example.name: sit_out-v
example.text: He sat out 1 term after [*PRO*-1] losing a U.S. Senate race in the 1960s.
example.arg: after [*PRO*-1] losing a U.S. Senate race in the 1960s.

roleset.name: act as substitute for during someone's temporary absence
roleset.note: SIT_IN-V NOTES: sit_in added by Miriam. No Vncls. (from sit.05-v)

example.name: sit_in-v
example.text: I'm Holly Firfer, [*PRO*-1] sitting in for Judy Fortin.

roleset.name: sit_in: visit in an unofficial capacity
roleset.note: SIT_IN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from sit.06-v)

role.descr: sitting in on what (e.g. meeting, class, etc)

example.name: sit_in-v: both args
example.text: I sat in on the meeting where they raised their salaries , and the attitudes of the council as they did this was astonishing .
example.arg: on the meeting where they raised their salaries , and the attitudes of the council as they did this was astonishing
